column1: The Elves  are a sundered people.  They awoke at Cuiviénen on the continent of Middle-earth (see: Awakening of the Elves)
column2: where they were divided into three tribes: the Vanyar
column4: and the Teleri. After some time
column5: they were summoned by Oromë to live with the Valar in Aman.  That summons and the Great Journey that followed split the Elves into two main groups (and many minor ones)

column1: The name Quendi refers to all elves.

column3: are those who refused the summons of Oromë. Most of the Avari came from the largest tribe
column4: the Teleri.  A few of the Noldor remained as well
column5: but were no longer called by that tribal name. Together with the Nandor and the Sindar
column6: they are called the Moriquendi ("Elves of Darkness") in recognition of the fact that they did not see the light of the Two Trees. The largest part of this group were Teleri
column7: since that was the most numerous people from the beginning
column8: and they suffered more than one sundering on their voyage to the western shore.  While all of the Eldar departed Middle-earth by the early Fourth Age
column9: it appears that the Avari mostly stayed or died out: there is no account of their passage Westward.

column1: The Eldar are those who accepted the summons.  Their name
column3: was given to them by Oromë in Primitive Quendian. Those of the Lindar who undertook the Great Journey were called the Teleri.

column1: * Those of the Teleri who refused to cross the Misty Mountains
column2: and stayed in the valley of the Anduin

column1: ** Those of the Nandor who left the Anduin under the leadership of Denethor of the Nandor and came to Beleriand are called the Laiquendi ("Green-elves").
** The other Nandor became known as the Silvan Elves
column2: living in the forests of  Rhovanion. They were joined there by some of the Avari.

column1: * Those of the Teleri who reached Beleriand by the Belegaer but chose not to cross to Aman were called the Sindar ("Grey-elves").
** Many of the Teleri chose to remain behind in order to look for their lord Thingol
column2: who disappeared near the end of the journey.  These were known as the Eglath ("The Forsaken")
column3: because they were left behind when their kindred crossed the Sea.

column1: ** Those of the Teleri who came to the shores of the Great Sea but decided to stay there are called the Falas ("People of the Shore").

column3: and those of the Teleri who stayed with them to the end are called the Calaquendi ("Elves of the Light") because they saw the Two Trees.

column1: ** Most of the Noldor returned with Fëanor to Middle-earth
column2: and at least some of these remained there through the Third Age.  These became known as the Exile of the Noldor.

column1: ** Those Noldor that remained behind or returned under Finarfin became known as the Aulendur ("Servants of Aulë").
